title: Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence

enrichment.summary: This executive order aims to remove existing government policies that restrict innovation in artificial intelligence (AI) to help the United States maintain its global leadership in AI technology. It directs key presidential advisors and government agencies to develop a new national AI action plan and review, revise, or suspend previous AI-related policies that might hinder innovation or contradict this goal.
potential_concerns: The revocation of safeguards from Executive Order 14110 may reduce protections against AI bias, potentially disadvantaging individuals-with-disabilities and other vulnerable groups in access to AI-powered services.

Emphasizing rapid AI innovation to maintain economic competitiveness may prioritize corporate interests and technology-workers' job growth while increasing workplace automation risks for working-age-adults in other sectors.

Removing restrictions on AI development without adequate ethical guidelines could lead to socially or ideologically biased AI systems, undermining public trust and harming demographic groups reliant on equitable AI outcomes.

Startups and entrepreneurs might benefit from reduced regulatory barriers, but the absence of clear standards could increase market uncertainty and inequalities between large corporations and smaller technology enterprises.
